trans-unit.source: A calendar view lets a user view and interact with a calendar that they can navigate by month, year, or decade.
trans-unit.target: A calendar view lets a user view and interact with a calendar that they can navigate by month, year, or decade.

trans-unit.source: Calendar view
trans-unit.target: Calendar view

trans-unit.source: Calendar view
trans-unit.target: Calendar view

trans-unit.source: A calendar view lets a user view and interact with a calendar that they can navigate by month, year, or decade.
trans-unit.target: A calendar view lets a user view and interact with a calendar that they can navigate by month, year, or decade.

trans-unit.source: A user can select a single date or a range of dates.
trans-unit.target: A user can select a single date or a range of dates.

trans-unit.source: It doesn't have a picker surface and the calendar is always visible.
trans-unit.target: It doesn't have a picker surface and the calendar is always visible.

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: CalendarView class
trans-unit.target: CalendarView class

trans-unit.source: Date property
trans-unit.target: Date property

trans-unit.source: Is this the right control?
trans-unit.target: Is this the right control?

trans-unit.source: Use a calendar view to let a user pick a single date or a range of dates from an always visible calendar.
trans-unit.target: Use a calendar view to let a user pick a single date or a range of dates from an always visible calendar.

trans-unit.source: If you need to let a user select multiple dates at one time, you must use a calendar view.
trans-unit.target: If you need to let a user select multiple dates at one time, you must use a calendar view.

trans-unit.source: If you need to let a user pick only a single date and don’t need a calendar to be always visible, consider using a [calendar date picker](calendar-date-picker.md) or [date picker](date-picker.md) control.
trans-unit.target: If you need to let a user pick only a single date and don’t need a calendar to be always visible, consider using a [calendar date picker](calendar-date-picker.md) or [date picker](date-picker.md) control.

trans-unit.source: For more info about choosing the right control, see the [Date and time controls](date-and-time.md) article.
trans-unit.target: For more info about choosing the right control, see the [Date and time controls](date-and-time.md) article.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: The calendar view is made up of 3 separate views: the month view, year view, and decade view.
trans-unit.target: The calendar view is made up of 3 separate views: the month view, year view, and decade view.

trans-unit.source: By default, it starts with the month view open.
trans-unit.target: By default, it starts with the month view open.

trans-unit.source: You can specify a startup view by setting the [**DisplayMode**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.displaymode.aspx) property.
trans-unit.target: You can specify a startup view by setting the [**DisplayMode**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.displaymode.aspx) property.

trans-unit.source: The 3 views of a calendar view
trans-unit.target: The 3 views of a calendar view

trans-unit.source: Users click the header in the month view to open the year view, and click the header in the year view to open the decade view.
trans-unit.target: Users click the header in the month view to open the year view, and click the header in the year view to open the decade view.

trans-unit.source: Users pick a year in the decade view to return to the year view, and pick a month in the year view to return to the month view.
trans-unit.target: Users pick a year in the decade view to return to the year view, and pick a month in the year view to return to the month view.

trans-unit.source: The two arrows to the side of the header navigate forward or backward by month, by year, or by decade.
trans-unit.target: The two arrows to the side of the header navigate forward or backward by month, by year, or by decade.

trans-unit.source: Create a calendar view
trans-unit.target: Create a calendar view

trans-unit.source: This example shows how to create a simple calendar view.
trans-unit.target: This example shows how to create a simple calendar view.

trans-unit.source: The resulting calendar view looks like this:
trans-unit.target: The resulting calendar view looks like this:

trans-unit.source: Example of calendar view
trans-unit.target: Example of calendar view

trans-unit.source: Selecting dates
trans-unit.target: Selecting dates

trans-unit.source: By default, the [**SelectionMode**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.selectionmode.aspx) property is set to **Single**.
trans-unit.target: By default, the [**SelectionMode**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.selectionmode.aspx) property is set to **Single**.

trans-unit.source: This lets a user pick a single date in the calendar.
trans-unit.target: This lets a user pick a single date in the calendar.

trans-unit.source: Set SelectionMode to **None** to disable date selection.
trans-unit.target: Set SelectionMode to **None** to disable date selection.

trans-unit.source: Set SelectionMode to **Multiple** to let a user select multiple dates.
trans-unit.target: Set SelectionMode to **Multiple** to let a user select multiple dates.

trans-unit.source: You can select multiple dates programmatically by adding [DateTime](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/system.datetime.aspx)/[DateTimeOffset](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/system.datetimeoffset.aspx) objects to the [**SelectedDates**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.selecteddates.aspx) collection, as shown here:
trans-unit.target: You can select multiple dates programmatically by adding [DateTime](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/system.datetime.aspx)/[DateTimeOffset](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/system.datetimeoffset.aspx) objects to the [**SelectedDates**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.selecteddates.aspx) collection, as shown here:

trans-unit.source: A user can deselect a selected date by clicking or tapping it in the calendar grid.
trans-unit.target: A user can deselect a selected date by clicking or tapping it in the calendar grid.

trans-unit.source: You can handle the [**SelectedDatesChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.selecteddateschanged.aspx) event to be notified when the [**SelectedDates**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.selecteddates.aspx) collection has changed.
trans-unit.target: You can handle the [**SelectedDatesChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.selecteddateschanged.aspx) event to be notified when the [**SelectedDates**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.selecteddates.aspx) collection has changed.

trans-unit.source: **Note**  For important info about date values, see [DateTime and Calendar values](date-and-time.md#datetime-and-calendar-values) in the Date and time controls article.
trans-unit.target: **Note**  For important info about date values, see [DateTime and Calendar values](date-and-time.md#datetime-and-calendar-values) in the Date and time controls article.

trans-unit.source: Customizing the calendar view's appearance
trans-unit.target: Customizing the calendar view's appearance

trans-unit.source: The calendar view is composed of both XAML elements defined in the ControlTemplate and visual elements rendered directly by the control.
trans-unit.target: The calendar view is composed of both XAML elements defined in the ControlTemplate and visual elements rendered directly by the control.

trans-unit.source: The XAML elements defined in the control template include the border that encloses the control, the header, previous and next buttons, and DayOfWeek elements.
trans-unit.target: The XAML elements defined in the control template include the border that encloses the control, the header, previous and next buttons, and DayOfWeek elements.

trans-unit.source: You can style and re-template these elements like any XAML control.
trans-unit.target: You can style and re-template these elements like any XAML control.

trans-unit.source: The calendar grid is composed of [**CalendarViewDayItem**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarviewdayitem.aspx) objects.
trans-unit.target: The calendar grid is composed of [**CalendarViewDayItem**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarviewdayitem.aspx) objects.

trans-unit.source: You can’t style or re-template these elements, but various properties are provided to let you to customize their appearance.
trans-unit.target: You can’t style or re-template these elements, but various properties are provided to let you to customize their appearance.

trans-unit.source: This diagram shows the elements that make up the month view of the calendar.
trans-unit.target: This diagram shows the elements that make up the month view of the calendar.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see the Remarks on the [**CalendarViewDayItem**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarviewdayitem.aspx) class.
trans-unit.target: For more info, see the Remarks on the [**CalendarViewDayItem**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarviewdayitem.aspx) class.

trans-unit.source: The elements of a calendar month view
trans-unit.target: The elements of a calendar month view

trans-unit.source: This table lists the properties you can change to modify the appearance of calendar elements.
trans-unit.target: This table lists the properties you can change to modify the appearance of calendar elements.

trans-unit.target: Element

trans-unit.target: OutofScope

trans-unit.source: Today
trans-unit.target: Today

trans-unit.source: [IsTodayHighlighted](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.istodayhighlighted.aspx), [TodayFontWeight](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.todayfontweight.aspx), [TodayForeground](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.todayforeground.aspx)
trans-unit.target: [IsTodayHighlighted](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.istodayhighlighted.aspx), [TodayFontWeight](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.todayfontweight.aspx), [TodayForeground](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.todayforeground.aspx)

trans-unit.source: By default, the month view shows 6 weeks at a time.
trans-unit.target: By default, the month view shows 6 weeks at a time.

trans-unit.source: You can change the number of weeks shown by setting the [**NumberOfWeeksInView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.numberofweeksinview.aspx) property.
trans-unit.target: You can change the number of weeks shown by setting the [**NumberOfWeeksInView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.numberofweeksinview.aspx) property.

trans-unit.source: The minimum number of weeks to show is 2; the maximum is 8.
trans-unit.target: The minimum number of weeks to show is 2; the maximum is 8.

trans-unit.source: By default, the year and decade views show in a 4x4 grid.
trans-unit.target: By default, the year and decade views show in a 4x4 grid.

trans-unit.source: To change the number of rows or columns, call [**SetYearDecadeDisplayDimensions**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.setyeardecadedisplaydimensions.aspx) with the your desired number of rows and columns.
trans-unit.target: To change the number of rows or columns, call [**SetYearDecadeDisplayDimensions**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.setyeardecadedisplaydimensions.aspx) with the your desired number of rows and columns.

trans-unit.source: This will change the grid for both the year and decade views.
trans-unit.target: This will change the grid for both the year and decade views.

trans-unit.source: Here, the year and decade views are set to show in a 3x4 grid.
trans-unit.target: Here, the year and decade views are set to show in a 3x4 grid.

trans-unit.source: By default, the minimum date shown in the calendar view is 100 years prior to the current date, and the maximum date shown is 100 years past the current date.
trans-unit.target: By default, the minimum date shown in the calendar view is 100 years prior to the current date, and the maximum date shown is 100 years past the current date.

trans-unit.source: You can change the minimum and maximum dates that the calendar shows by setting the [**MinDate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.mindate.aspx) and [**MaxDate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.maxdate.aspx) properties.
trans-unit.target: You can change the minimum and maximum dates that the calendar shows by setting the [**MinDate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.mindate.aspx) and [**MaxDate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.maxdate.aspx) properties.

trans-unit.source: Updating calendar day items
trans-unit.target: Updating calendar day items

trans-unit.source: Each day in the calendar is represented by a [**CalendarViewDayItem**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarviewdayitem.aspx) object.
trans-unit.target: Each day in the calendar is represented by a [**CalendarViewDayItem**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarviewdayitem.aspx) object.

trans-unit.source: To access an individual day item and use its properties and methods, handle the [**CalendarViewDayItemChanging**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.calendarviewdayitemchanging.aspx) event and use the Item property of the event args to access the CalendarViewDayItem.
trans-unit.target: To access an individual day item and use its properties and methods, handle the [**CalendarViewDayItemChanging**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.calendarviewdayitemchanging.aspx) event and use the Item property of the event args to access the CalendarViewDayItem.

trans-unit.source: You can make a day not selectable in the calendar view by setting its [**CalendarViewDayItem.IsBlackout**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarviewdayitem.isblackout.aspx) property to **true**.
trans-unit.target: You can make a day not selectable in the calendar view by setting its [**CalendarViewDayItem.IsBlackout**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarviewdayitem.isblackout.aspx) property to **true**.

trans-unit.source: You can show contextual information about the density of events in a day by calling the [**CalendarViewDayItem.SetDensityColors**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/dn890067.aspx) method.
trans-unit.target: You can show contextual information about the density of events in a day by calling the [**CalendarViewDayItem.SetDensityColors**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/dn890067.aspx) method.

trans-unit.source: You can show from 0 to 10 density bars for each day, and set the color of each bar.
trans-unit.target: You can show from 0 to 10 density bars for each day, and set the color of each bar.

trans-unit.source: Here are some day items in a calendar.
trans-unit.target: Here are some day items in a calendar.

trans-unit.source: Days 1 and 2 are blacked out.
trans-unit.target: Days 1 and 2 are blacked out.

trans-unit.source: Days 2, 3, and 4 have various density bars set.
trans-unit.target: Days 2, 3, and 4 have various density bars set.

trans-unit.source: Calendar days with density bars
trans-unit.target: Calendar days with density bars

trans-unit.source: Phased rendering
trans-unit.target: Phased rendering

trans-unit.source: A calendar view can contain a large number of CalendarViewDayItem objects.
trans-unit.target: A calendar view can contain a large number of CalendarViewDayItem objects.

trans-unit.source: To keep the UI responsive and enable smooth navigation through the calendar, calendar view supports phased rendering.
trans-unit.target: To keep the UI responsive and enable smooth navigation through the calendar, calendar view supports phased rendering.

trans-unit.source: This lets you break up processing of a day item into phases.
trans-unit.target: This lets you break up processing of a day item into phases.

trans-unit.source: If a day is moved out of view before all the phases are complete, no more time is used trying to process and render that item.
trans-unit.target: If a day is moved out of view before all the phases are complete, no more time is used trying to process and render that item.

trans-unit.source: This example shows phased rendering of a calendar view for scheduling appointments.
trans-unit.target: This example shows phased rendering of a calendar view for scheduling appointments.

trans-unit.source: In phase 0, the default day item is rendered.
trans-unit.target: In phase 0, the default day item is rendered.

trans-unit.source: In phase 1, you blackout dates that can't be booked.
trans-unit.target: In phase 1, you blackout dates that can't be booked.

trans-unit.source: This includes past dates, Sundays, and dates that are already fully booked.
trans-unit.target: This includes past dates, Sundays, and dates that are already fully booked.

trans-unit.source: In phase 2, you check each appointment that's booked for the day.
trans-unit.target: In phase 2, you check each appointment that's booked for the day.

trans-unit.source: You show a green density bar for each confirmed appointment and a blue density bar for each tentative appointment.
trans-unit.target: You show a green density bar for each confirmed appointment and a blue density bar for each tentative appointment.

trans-unit.source: The `Bookings` class in this example is from a fictitious appointment booking app, and is not shown.
trans-unit.target: The `Bookings` class in this example is from a fictitious appointment booking app, and is not shown.

trans-unit.source: \[This article contains information that is specific to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[This article contains information that is specific to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and Windows 10.
